page.title: 09An old pupil remembers.
page.content: We recently went in a small group to talk to Mrs Hinett who is the oldest resident in Brereton.She has lived here for 89years and went to the school at the age of 5 and left at the age of 14.The school then had 4 class- rooms and 4 teachers,the Headmaster, his wife,his daughter and an outside teacher from Sandbach.There was no playground as such,the children were able to use the School-house garden and also the road alongside as there was very little traffic. All written work was done on slates with either a slate pencil or with chalk.They had quite a few textbooks but not as many as we have nowadays. The children came to school from quite a wide area including theWorkhouse at Arclid.Of course there were no buses then to transport the children.
